info.description:
The e-mail service implements all e-mail functions for GroupAlarm

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->
info.title: groupalarm E-Mail API

get.description: Returns all configured alarm-notification email adresses of an user

parameters.description: requesting organization, not required if user accesses his own resources
parameters.name: organization_id

200.description: all email adresses of the requested user

items.description: Definition of an billing request payload

active.description: defines, if this email is active for alarm notifications

name.description: user defined name for this address (e.g. private)

ownerID.description: assinged user id for this email

400.description: owner id is missing or in a wrong format

parameters.description: requesting organization, not required if user accesses his own resources
parameters.name: organization_id

schema.description: Definition of an billing request payload

active.description: defines, if this email is active for alarm notifications

name.description: user defined name for this address (e.g. private)

ownerID.description: assinged user id for this email

400.description: email payload is missing or in a wrong format

schema.description: Definition of an billing request payload

active.description: defines, if this email is active for alarm notifications

name.description: user defined name for this address (e.g. private)

ownerID.description: assinged user id for this email

get.description: Returns whether the given organization has disabled this way of alarming or not

200.description: whether this way of alarming is disabled or not

items.description: IsDisabled is the request and response of requests via the api

400.description: organization_id is missing or in wrong format

put.description: Sets whether the given organization has this way of alarming disabled or not

400.description: organization_id is missing or in wrong format

schema.description: IsDisabled is the request and response of requests via the api

API_Token.description: To use this API, you need an API-Token from the RBAC settings of your GroupAlarm organization. Place the token inside the HTTP-Header `API-Token` for every request, otherwise the API will return an "401 Unauthorized" error for your request.
API_Token.name: API-TOKEN

Personal-Access-Token.description: To use this API, you need a Personal Access Token from your profile settings. Place the token inside the HTTP-Header `Personal-Access-Token` for every request, otherwise the API will return an "401 Unauthorized" error for your request.
Personal-Access-Token.name: Personal-Access-Token

AccessAllowedResponse.description: AccessAllowedResponse contains whether the organization allows access or not

Alarm.description: This is used for the interaction with alarms
Alarm.title: Alarm describes an alarm payload

endDate.description: time where this event was closed

name.description: user given name for this event

scheduledEndtime.description: time this event is scheduled for close

feedback.description: all feedback payloads for all notified users

items.description: Feedback describes a feedback payload

feedbackPercentage.description: FeedbackPercentage describes the percentage of an alarm feedback

isDemo.description: demo alarms/organizations use a demo algorithm for positioning

optionalContent.description:
PropertyMap is used as container for additional data in alarms or messages
it can be stored and retrieved easily in our Postgres database

organizationID.description: id of organization for this alarm/event

scenario.description: Scenario contains all values of a scenario payload

description.description: user given description for this scenario

instructionCatalogID.description: possible id of an instruction catalog

name.description: user given name for this scenario

sendPosition.description: send position to users after alarm is closed

units.description: all units by their ID in an array

items.description: This is used for the unit interactions
items.title: Unit describes an unit payload

organizationID.description: connected organization by the organization ID

unitParts.description: assigned unit parts for labels and their amounts

items.description: This is used for the unit parts inside the unit payload
items.title: UnitPart describes an unit part payload

additionalProperties.description: This is used for the strength interaction
additionalProperties.title: Strength describes the strength payload

amount.description: amount of strength members for a specific alarm

labelStrengths.description: label with amount for this strength

items.description: This payload connects labels with an amount of user for a strength
items.title: LabelStrength describes a strength payload

amount.description: amount of strength members for a specific alarm

success.description: successful alarm; true, when all positions are fulfilled

Email.description: Definition of an billing request payload

active.description: defines, if this email is active for alarm notifications

name.description: user defined name for this address (e.g. private)

ownerID.description: assinged user id for this email

delay.description: configured delay in seconds, when escalation is used after the last one

wayofalarm.description: type of the alarming way e.g. email

EscalationConfiguration.description: Definition of an escalation configuration payload

items.description: Definition of a single escalation

delay.description: configured delay in seconds, when escalation is used after the last one

wayofalarm.description: type of the alarming way e.g. email

organizationID.description: organization id for editing escalation as an organization administrator

userID.description: assigned user for this escalation configuration for organization administrator editing

escalationTier.description: current escalation tier for this message beginning at 0

maxEscalationTier.description: max escalation tier for this message

endDate.description: time where this event was closed

name.description: user given name for this event

scheduledEndtime.description: time this event is scheduled for close

EventCreationItem.description: EventCreationItem is used by the different services to create a new audit-log item

EventList.description: An EventList contains multiple EventListItems and a TotalEvents count used for pagination

items.description: An EventListItem is used as a single audit-log entry in an EventList

active.description: describes, if the email was verified

availablePreference.description: defines if a user wants to be available or not

availableStatus.description: DispatchStatus describes the current status of a user

avatarURL.description: URL to the avatar of the user

editable.description: describes, if the user wants to be edited by an organization administrator

pending.description: defines an pending invitation (user is known, but hasn't logged in yet)

token.description: current JWT token for this session

totalEvents.description: total amount of events inside the events array
